events.event_name: WTI crude oil futures price drop
events.description: WTI crude oil futures fell more than 3% to around $63 per barrel on Thursday.
Iran confirmed it will hold negotiations with the US in Oman on Friday to reduce military conflict risks.
Release of weaker US private jobs data affecting economic outlook.
The US and Russia agreed to resume high level military contacts.

facts.fact_text: WTI crude oil futures fell more than 3% to around $63 per barrel on Thursday.

evidences.evidence_text: WTI crude oil futures fell more than 3% to around $63 per barrel on Thursday

facts.fact_text: Iran will hold negotiations with the US in Oman on Friday.

evidences.evidence_text: Iran confirmed it will hold negotiations with the US in Oman on Friday

facts.fact_text: The Middle East accounts for about a third of global crude supply.

evidences.evidence_text: the Middle East, which accounts for about a third of global crude supply

facts.fact_text: The US and Russia agreed to resume high level military contacts.

evidences.evidence_text: the US and Russia agreed to resume high level military contacts

claims.claim_text: Easing geopolitical tensions and demand concerns pressured oil prices.

evidences.evidence_text: reversing a two-day advance as easing geopolitical tensions and demand concerns pressured prices

claims.claim_text: Negotiations reduce the immediate risk of military conflict and supply disruptions.

evidences.evidence_text: reducing the immediate risk of military conflict and potential supply disruptions from the major OPEC producer

claims.claim_text: Weaker US private jobs data revived concerns about an economic slowdown and softer fuel demand.

evidences.evidence_text: Prices also came under pressure after weaker US private jobs data revived concerns about an economic slowdown and softer fuel demand

claims.claim_text: Uncertainty remains over whether Washington and Tehran can bridge key differences.

evidences.evidence_text: Still, uncertainty remains over whether Washington and Tehran can bridge key differences, keeping some risk premium in the market

evidence.evidence_text: The news eased some of the geopolitical risk premium tied to the Middle East
weaker US private jobs data revived concerns about an economic slowdown
easing geopolitical tensions and demand concerns pressured prices
revived concerns about an economic slowdown and softer fuel demand
